channel.title: Wifi adapters
channel.description:
Well my friends computer got fucked up, and we eventually fixed it, but whatever happened to it, deleted the wifi adapter itself... Now I cant find a download for JUST an adapter, I already have a driver but the adapter just isn't there...
Any help?

item.title: Wifi adapters
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

what is the wifi adapter your using?

Read full topic

item.title: Wifi adapters
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

He claimed he tried and it didn’t work. He’s obviously doing something wrong, or this isn’t his problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Wifi adapters
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

Just download the drivers specific to your hardware and operating system? I don’t see what the problem is.

Read full topic

item.title: Wifi adapters
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

If it doesn’t fix the issue, you need to download the drivers on YOUR computer, (the one you’re replying here with) put them on some sort of flash drive / disk then install them on the laptop without the drivers.

There’s only one brand of computer I didn’t have this issue with when re-installing an OS. Which was a eMachines.

the others (Toshiba, Acer and HP) I have done this to have all uninstalled their drivers when re-installing the OS.

Read full topic

item.title: Wifi adapters
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

there is never a guarantee that a piece of software will 100% work with hardware.

Read full topic

item.title: Wifi adapters
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

Download the driver from the computer manufacture’s website and put it onto a USB stick then transfer it to your laptop or whatever.

[quote=“Scyth_, post:12, topic:454028”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=556902.msg4075944#msg4075944 date=1344829945]
you can if you really cba to fix
[/quote]

So it WILL fix the problem?[/quote]

It might, might not.

Read full topic

Obviously you didn’t do it right.

That WILL work. Unless this is a different problem. Did you guys re-install the OS?

We reinstalled to a different OS, the customer support lady said that wasnt a problem
[/quote]that IS a problem.

even on my crappy laptop if I go to the acer website and to my model it with have different downloads for the specific os you are using.[/quote]
